ai.summary: The North Wingfield Walk is a roughly 7.1 km circular hike in the UK rated as moderate. It traverses countryside paths with gentle elevation changes and varied terrain, suitable for hikers with some experience.
ai.terrain_summary: A mix of surfaced tracks, grassy paths, and compact gravel sections. Expect uneven ground, small ascents, and potential mud, especially after rain. Gate or stile crossings are common along the route.
ai.safety_notes: Wear sturdy footwear and check the weather before you start. Stay on marked paths, be mindful of livestock, and watch for muddy or uneven ground. Carry a map or GPS, a charged phone, and inform someone of your plan and expected return time. Keep dogs under control and be cautious of other hikers on narrow sections.
recommended_gear: Map, compass or GPS, and a charged phone
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (roughly March to October) when days are longer and the weather is generally milder; in winter the route can be very muddy and conditions may be less predictable.

seo.title: North Wingfield Walk - 7.1 km Moderate Hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Explore the North Wingfield Walk, a 7.1 km moderately challenging hike in the UK. Learn about terrain, safety tips, gear, and the best seasons to enjoy this route.
